results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Luke Broadwater
results.title: ‘Kind of Wild/Creative’: Emails Shed Light on Trump Fake Electors Plan
results.abstract: Previously undisclosed communications among Trump campaign aides and outside advisers provide new insight into their efforts to overturn the election in the weeks leading to Jan. 6.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: One Arizona Republican involved in the effort to reverse the election outcome advocated keeping a key element of the strategy quiet “so we can try to ‘surprise’ the Dems and media with it” on Jan. 6, 2021.
media.copyright: Ash Ponders for The New York Times

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: International Space Station;United States International Relations;Space and Astronomy;Borisov, Yuri;Roscosmos;National Aeronautics and Space Administration;Russia
results.byline: By Kenneth Chang and Ivan Nechepurenko
results.title: Russia Says It Will Quit the International Space Station After 2024
results.abstract: The withdrawal would end two decades of post-Cold War cooperation in space between the United States and Russia, which jointly built and operate the station.

media.caption: The International Space Station, photographed from a Russian spacecraft in 2018, was built as a symbol of post-Cold War cooperation between the world’s space superpowers.

results.byline: By Knvul Sheikh and Hannah Seo
results.title: How to Live With Covid When You Are Tired of Living With Covid
results.abstract: The BA.5 surge is a reminder that we need to take precautions to avoid illness, slow the relentless cycle of new variants and minimize the disruption to our daily lives.

media.copyright: Michelle V. Agins/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Baseball;Sporting Goods and Equipment;Soil;audio-neutral-immersive;audio-positive-escape;audio-positive-nostalgic;Major League Baseball;Delaware River;New Jersey
results.title: He’s Baseball’s Only Mud Supplier. It’s a Job He May Soon Lose.
results.abstract: Jim Bintliff collects the Delaware River mud that is smeared on Major League baseballs to make them less slippery. But that tradition is in jeopardy.

media.caption: Jim Bintliff and his family have been selling Delaware River mud to Major League Baseball for decades. Here, he fills a bucket in New Jersey.
media.copyright: Hannah Beier for The New York Times

results.title: Joni Mitchell Performs Surprise Show at Newport Folk Festival
results.abstract: The 78-year-old artist performed a full set, her first in about two decades, at the renowned festival in Rhode Island on Sunday.

media.caption: Joni Mitchell, who has rarely appeared in public in recent years, performed some of her most iconic songs, including an extended guitar solo on “Just Like This Train” from her “Court and Spark” album.

results.adx_keywords: Robberies and Thefts;Jewels and Jewelry;Whitehead, Lamor M;Leaders of Tomorrow International Ministries;Canarsie (Brooklyn, NY)
results.title: Brooklyn Clergyman Is Robbed While Delivering Sunday Sermon
results.abstract: A trio of armed individuals robbed Lamor M. Whitehead and his wife of  jewelry worth more than $1 million, police said.

media.caption: Lamor M. Whitehead, a bishop at the Leaders of Tomorrow International Ministries in Brooklyn, said he was mid-sermon when he was robbed at gunpoint.

results.adx_keywords: International Relations;United States International Relations;War and Armed Conflicts;Defense and Military Forces;Territorial Disputes;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Pelosi, Nancy;Xi Jinping;Taiwan Strait;People's Liberation Army (China);China;Russia;Taiwan
results.byline: By Edward Wong, David E. Sanger and Amy Qin
results.title: U.S. Officials Grow More Concerned About Potential Action by China on Taiwan
results.abstract: The Biden administration is watching for any moves by China to close off the Taiwan Strait, and they would prefer that Nancy Pelosi cancel her planned trip.

media.caption: Taipei shoppers at dusk. Suspicions in Washington and Taipei of China’s intentions toward Taiwan have increased during the conflict in Ukraine, because Chinese officials have consistently supported Russian rationales for the invasion.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Elections;Trump, Donald J;Pence, Mike;Republican Party;Washington (DC)
results.title: Trump-Pence Ticket, Torn by Jan. 6, Becomes an Unequal Rivalry
results.abstract: Trailed by the Capitol riot fallout and 2024 speculation, the two erstwhile allies gave competing speeches that revealed the Republican Party’s enduring challenges and divisions.

media.caption: In his speech on Tuesday, Donald J. Trump repeatedly veered off script to complain about “hoax” investigations and lie about his 2020 election loss.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Deaths (Obituaries);Billingsley, Barbara;Dow, Tony;Mathers, Jerry;Beaumont, Hugh;CBS Corporation
results.title: Editors’ Note
results.abstract: An obituary of the actor Tony Dow was published in error. The Times based the confirmation of his death on a Facebook post by his representatives, which proved erroneous and has since been deleted.

results.title: DNA Researchers Name the Somerton Man, Australia’s 73-Year-Old Cold Case
results.abstract: Sleuths amateur and professional alike have been puzzled for years by the discovery in 1948 of an unidentified man’s body slumped by a sea wall near Adelaide. The South Australian police have not verified the new finding.

media.caption: Pallbearers carrying the exhumed remains of the so-called Somerton Man last year in Adelaide, Australia.

results.adx_keywords: Landlords;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Rent Control and Stabilization;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);StreetEasy;Manhattan (NYC)
results.title: New York Renters Are Now Paying the Price for the ‘Covid Discount’
results.abstract: More than 40 percent of the available units in Manhattan currently come from tenants priced out of apartments they leased in 2020 and 2021, according to a new StreetEasy report.

media.caption: Cathy Linh Che scrambled to find another apartment in the Two Bridges neighborhood in Manhattan after the rent on her pandemic-deal apartment increased by 65 percent.
media.copyright: Clark Hodgin for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Track and Field;Records and Achievements;IAAF World Athletics Championships;Johnson, Michael (1967- );Amusan, Tobi (1997- )
results.title: An Amazing World Record Runs Into a Question: Was It Too Amazing?
results.abstract: After Tobi Amusan of Nigeria smashed a hurdles record at the world championships, the former gold medalist Michael Johnson raised doubts about the race’s unusually fast times.

media.caption: Tobi Amusan of Nigeria broke the world record in the 100-meter hurdles on Sunday.

results.title: How Much Should I Spend to Keep My Elderly Dog Alive?
results.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how to do right by our pets as they reach the end of life.

results.title: Justice Dept. Asking Witnesses About Trump in Its Jan. 6 Investigation
results.abstract: Federal prosecutors sought information about the former president’s role in the efforts to overturn the election as the inquiry accelerates.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Even as the Jan. 6 committee has helped establish former President Donald J. Trump’s role in parts of the push to overturn his election loss, the Justice Department has been largely silent about whether it would weigh potential charges against him.

results.byline: By Michael Levenson, Christine Hauser and Eric Berger
results.title: Flash Floods Swamp St. Louis Area, Breaking a Century-Old Rain Record
results.abstract: One person died after being pulled from a flooded vehicle, and property damage was “very significant” in some hard-hit areas, the city’s fire chief said.

media.caption: John Ward, left, and a firefighter helped Lynn Hartke wade through the water on Hermitage Avenue in St. Louis on Tuesday after flash floods hit the region.

results.title: Top Pence Aides Testify to Grand Jury in Jan. 6 Investigation
results.abstract: Marc Short, who was chief of staff to Vice President Mike Pence, and Greg Jacob, a lawyer for Mr. Pence, were subpoenaed in the Justice Department’s expanding criminal inquiry.

media.caption: It remains unclear precisely what Marc Short told the grand jury or what questions prosecutors may have asked him.

results.title: The Choco Taco, Ice Cream Snack of American Summers, Is Discontinued

media.caption: The Choco Taco has been discontinued, much to its fans’ dismay.

results.title: Kushner Says He Was Treated for Thyroid Cancer While in White House
results.abstract: In a memoir to be published next month, former President Donald Trump’s son-in-law wrote that he wanted the diagnosis and treatment kept quiet.

media.caption: Jared Kushner, former President Donald J. Trump’s son-in-law and senior adviser, wrote about a 2019 cancer diagnosis in an forthcoming memoir.
